Reviews.Title: “One of the better one”
Reviews.Author: JKCJ
Reviews.Content: Pros:- 1. Located at the end of Kimberly which means that you get away from the crowd yet you are less than a min walk to the cafes, restaurants and shops in TST. Walking distance to East TST station and TST station so you enjoy two different subway lines. Refer to the MTR map and you will know what I mean. 2. Beds are clean (refer to cons for more details) 3. Reception service is good. 4. Concierge is helpful and will guide you to other places in Hong Kong. 5. Lighting is good in the room. Good for those on business trip. Cons:- 1. Small double bed. It will be a squeeze if you belong to the bigger size group and you share with your spouse. 2. They do not really clean the floor of the room. 3. Small toilet. (common in Hong Kong) 4. No wifi in the room!!! we are paying for such high price for the room yet they do not install Wifi. 5. Chargeable wifi. 6. Poor breakfast. Walk out and grab the local breakfast at a fraction of the price. 7. Daily room cleaning service is slow. You probably have to wait till about 2-3pm for them to come to tidy up your room. Unless you call and complain.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay, restaurant is good but no indian food”
Reviews.Author: Natarajathithan
Reviews.Content: many shopping place and hongkong science musium and metro rail and indian restaurant is walkable distance name Himalaya restaurant in 1st floor, food is very nice ,water is very costly compare to Beer in hongkong , taxi is very reasonable price ,metro bus is near to hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Good location and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Mabrio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the great location, close to the MTR, Islamic Center, the hotel room was cleaning ant the service was good!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: Nicole W
Reviews.Content: We booked adjoining room (a room with access to the other room without having to go into corridor) a concept they didn't understand they only gave as rooms next to each other. The rooms stank of cigarette smoke. After much debating we were moved to rooms that weren't even next to each other on the 'lifestyle' floor. These rooms are TINY, the bathroom is a glass box in the corner of the room, no privacy. The hallway always smelt like dirty washing. The breakfast was cold, obviously cooked at 6am and left to sit all the way through service, we rarely saw anyone else at breakfast. One night we opted for room service for dinner - worst meal I ate on my travels. The staff at reception were rude and disinterested. Would never return - spend your money else where!

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, but actually slept very well”
Reviews.Author: TimBrooksbank
Reviews.Content: The room is tiny, you can only just walk round one side of the bed, the other side is against the wall. Giant TV in minute room is silly as you can't actually watch it properly. Nice shower, shame the toilet doesn't work properly, but that seems common in HK, Bed remarkably comfy and room quiet, actually slept well so as a place to sleep it works well, but it isn't anywhere you could actually enjoy being in the room. Don't pay for the cable internet connection if you're on business, all VPN access is blocked, all you can do is browse websites. They will hire you a USB broadband modem instead, or take your own. This is the downside of the hotel - it's not really set up for business travellers. I'd go back on my own, just as a place to sleep, but I'd never choose it if I was there over a weekend and wanted somewhere nice.

Reviews.Title: “Valued for $$$”
Reviews.Author: BobsterSG
Reviews.Content: Had booked a Lifestyle room but was given an upgrade to City View room. Excellent room with high ceiling and spacious room. To have a spacious room in Hong Kong for tat rate is almost impossible to find. Overall room is clean and furnitures are very new too. With a 46" LCD TV and cable tv available. A good hotel to consider for all business travellers. Location is excellent too. Lots of Korean restaurant just behind the hotel and also the Famous Tai Ping Koon restaurant is just behnd it too.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: JHTauckland
Reviews.Content: Service was average, rooms were small and quite dated, no wireless! Ok for a working trip to HK, not the sort of place you'd want to stay at for a holiday in Hong Kong, in my opinion you'd want something better than just average.

Reviews.Title: “Good hôtel. May be better”
Reviews.Author: Batignols
Reviews.Content: excellent location in Kowloon close to everything. Had a nice room with great harbour view but quite small as often in China. Decent not outstanding breakfast. Noisy clim. Paying internet access in the room - unpleasant and loss of time, did not work the first time . A good hôtel but may become a better one.

Reviews.Title: “Give breakfast a miss . . .”
Reviews.Author: haitistarfish
Reviews.Content: Before I traveled, I noted that several reviews of this hotel mentioned the breakfast buffet, the price etc so I was aware that it would cost about $14, but that with so many nearby places to eat, this pricey option could be easily overcome. So true. But I did eat breakfast there, twice, over two weeks, and discovered the cost was $148 HKD plus 10 percent service charge (about $20 CAD / USD). Now in Canada, when one pays upwards of $20 for any buffet, one usually gets a pretty decent buffet. Not so with this hotel buffet: most of the foods seemed to be leftovers from the dinner buffet the night before. The dimsum was doughy, the scrambled eggs had me wondering what they had done to make them so rubbery and un-egglike, the carrots were drowned in water, the noodles were tasteless. The fresh fruit (two choices), congee (with toppings, a personal favourite) oatmeal and cereal were okay. Why did I eat there twice? To make sure that the first time was not a blip due to staff shortages at Chinese New Year. But the hotel itself is well located, the staff pleasant and accommodating, the room lovely. I was more than happy to make coffee in my room, then head out to a nearby McDonalds and get my scrambled eggs, sausage patty, home fries and coffee for under $4 USD/ CAD, and enjoy it a whole lot more. Note: the pool is closed for about 4 months over the winter season, and the spa/massage therapist are not on-site, but called into the hotel spa area as needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot, Below average customer service.”
Reviews.Author: SpGish20
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the location of this hotel, as it was within walking distance of many shops and places to eat. The hotel was clean and the internet speeds were acceptable. For the most part the staff was nice, except for a few staff members that gave this rating lower than what it could be. I had an unpleasant experience with some staff in the Empire Club. Even though I had access to this section, I was approached with an unpleasant accusation that I was in the club without the access to it. After checking my room to see that I DID have access to the Club, an apology was given, then it was all kind words. I don’t know if I was being judged by my appearance or they are normally that rude. Besides the few rude staff members, the hotel is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad location for Hong Kong, Customer service needs work”
Reviews.Author: btravels20
Reviews.Content: This Hotel would rank higher if it wasnt for the customer service. Some of the employees were very good but they were off set by the bad ones. I booked a room that granted access to the Empire Club. But when I went to use the club the conversation went this way, "excuse me sir you are not supposed to be here." Why not was my reply. They came back with, "This is for our valued guest that have paid extra" I did pay extra for this service I would tell them, and after a check of my room number a profuse apology followed, but the damage had been done. This happened to me twice in three days. I am guessing the level of customer service they provide is based on the appearance of the guest. Other than the poor customer service there is really nothing wrong with this Hotel. Rooms are small, location is not too bad, just a short walk to the MTR and Nathian Road. If you just need a place to rest your head in Hong Kong this will do but dont expect much for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Tuscany444
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights before our onward trip to China. Very convenient for getting around and the airport bus stopped outside each way bookable in the foyer at the airport. staff were friendly and efficient. Woould have liked more lounge area and seating arrangements but not in the hotel too often except when the typhoon hit !! In all a good place to stay breakfast very substantial and rooms very clean and spacious.Cityscape view from the window.We were verrrry high up Tuscany

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel but Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bloomg
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Hong Kong so we were a bit shocked at first with the size of the room but we got used to it after a while. Apparently we were also upgraded to a Superior Room so bit of a worry if the standard rooms were smaller (??). The room was very clean with a modern bathroom, we had some issues with the bathroom, the toilet wasn't flushing properly and shower was blocked but they attended to these issues promptly when we complained. Agree with many of the comments in the other reviews; service is very poor, the hotel is outdated and the breakfast buffet left a lot to be desired, not a great deal of choice. The food seemed to run out (ie OJ, pastries etc) and the manager of the restaurant seemed more interested to stand and talk with the same asian guests every day rather than attend to the other guests. We had to get our own tea and coffee although we did notice he sometimes filled up some guests cups on an adhoc basis. We were very busy sightseeing so did not spend a lot of time in the room so it was okay but we would not stay in this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong - tricky to choose a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: This is a very bustling hotel- very fitting for a city like Hong Kong. The Empire is perfect for a business traveller everything was very satisfactory. Choosen for it's location near a great street of restaurants. Would not hesitate to book again, for Hong Kong rooms are a very reasonable size for the price.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is difficult to review because it is all about your expectations. Hotels in Hong Kong are expensive and we were there over New Year. This hotel is not cheap and you do feel that you should be getting more for your money - the rooms are very small, the customer service is rather limited, the overall condition of the hotel is relatively poor. However, the location is good, within easy walking distance of the shopping in Kowloon and TST. We walked to and from the NYE celebrations on the waterfront in no time at all. It depends on how much time you plan to spend in the room. If, like us, you go to Hong Kong to get out and about then this hotel should be OK but don't have high expectations!

Reviews.Title: “great location,but almost non existent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Saint-trav
Reviews.Content: Firstly i must say that this was our first trip to Hong Kong and it was hard to work out exactly where was the best location to stay. The location of the Empire Hotel was great, just off Nathon rd and not too far away from the MTR... The hotel itself wasn't too bad, but the customer service is dramatically lacking here (simple things like taking your luggage or even opening the door for you while trying to get your luggage into the hotel didn't happen here) Also we were left waiting at the concierge desk for over 20mins without being seen when we wanted to enquire about getting Wi-Fi (and it wasn't particularly busy with people checking in or out at that time either) Our room was absolutely tiny, but due to us spending most of our time outside of the hotel exploring this wonderful city and only really returning to sleep it wasn't a big issue for us.. I would suggest to anyone looking to come to Hong Kong for the first time that this hotel could be an option if the location is the most important thing and you're not planning on spending much time in your room other than to sleep. If however you are expecting great customer service as well then unfortunately you will be extremely disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a nice price”
Reviews.Author: zacstar
Reviews.Content: We got the HK in the middle of convention week so everything was much more expensive than usual, including the Empire, but its a solid performer despite some issues with our arrival. We had a blocked toilet and difficulty communicating that to satff. Got it fixed but took a while. Good room and bed. The pool is in a weird place at the bottom of a highrise void through the building but we needed it and it did its job. Free Airport Shuttle to Kowloon Railway Station (to connect to airport trian) at the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, service issues”
Reviews.Author: potatofish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two nights. The a/c was not working properly in our room so it never got cooler than 25 degrees Celsius. I complained after the first day and they said they would send someone to fix it and if not fixed we could switch rooms. That was before we went out for the day to spend some time in Hong Kong. We returned to find out no one even looked at the room at which point I complained they said they would send someone "right up". I waited for a half hour that I could have been taking a shower for a person who never showed up. I then called the front desk and told them plain and simple I would like to switch rooms. Then they were prompts and sent up someone to help take our luggage to another room. The hotel appears to be quite nice on the inside but has some service issues. My husband had stayed here in the past and said he will not return now...he was giving it a second chance after some service issues the time before.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel e well located”
Reviews.Author: Roberto G
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't have the amenities of the more luxurious hotels but has all the needs necessary for a comfortable stay. It is very well located, in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, near the Victoria Harbour and near Nathan Road and Canton Road.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at very good location in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: RKBeij
Reviews.Content: If you like the busy area of Kowloon, it is a very good location right in the middle. Nathan Road and the piers are just around the corner in walking distance. Breakfast I think too expensive. But also, alternatives are just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MauriceNZ
Reviews.Content: The only advantage this hotel has is it's site. Very close to Nathan Rd and only 12mins walk to the waterfront. Also beautiful gardens up the steps across Nathan Rd from the end of Courtney Rd. There is a very nice Lane with a range of excellent international food places within 70metres. I would rate the Empire as barely 3 star. The room was small and needs a complete upgrade. The air-con that didn't work was so noisy we couldn't sleep with it. I called the maintenance man who explained that it was very old and took a long time to work. NO. After the second day the shifted us to a top floor room that had air-con and was marginally larger but almost as noisy and with an air freshener didn't smell too bad.. There was no warmth or feeling from the staff and the only staff member who spoke to us was a young Bell Boy and he was friendly and smiley on the days he was working. There are other Hotels close by that other tourists said they enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the price”
Reviews.Author: jessatwest
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights while on a mini-break. I have to say that for the price ($200/night) it was a disappointment. We had 2 twin beds that were probably actually smaller than twin beds. We barely had enough room to walk once we put our luggage down. The room had a "wiped down" look to it, and I could tell from the water stains on the sink counter that only the bare minimum had been done to clean it. The rugs look like they have not been cleaned for years, and the entire hallway and elevator area smelled like damp mold. The sheets were thin and so were the blankets. The beds were hard as a rock. I also got temporarily locked in the bathroom because the lock on the door was installed wrong and the screw fell out! Good thing I was traveling with Mr Fix-it! They have Wi-Fi but you have to pay for it--I believe it was about $18 USD for one 24 hour period of usage. I had to ask several times for them to connect me because their website was not working. The good qualities of the hotel were primarily the location (walking distance to the Museum of Art and waterfront) and the fantastic buffet breakfasts. For $14 USD per person there is an incredible variety of Eastern and Western cuisine to choose from, as well as a line cook ready to take omelet orders. Miso soup, congee, cereals, breads, bacon, eggs, omelets, pastries, yogurts, teas and coffee, steamed buns, salmon, sausages...different kinds of juices. The hotel will also co-ordinate tours--I believe it was $45 USD per person for a whole day of sightseeing, which spotlighted the main things we wanted to see anyway, such as The Peak, the tram ride up to the Peak, a visit to a temple and a harbour ride. If you just want a relatively cheap place to crash this location is good. I wouldn't choose it for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “great bed, decent location”
Reviews.Author: harbrsl
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel about 4 years ago and the bed was rock hard. i was pleasantly surprised to see that they have changed the beds to a hugely comfortable pillowtop mattress with softer pillows. thank you!!! this was the best part of the hotel. the room was an ok size but the bed was clearly smaller than they anticipated as the nightstands were both very far from the actual bed. this gave more room to walk around which was nice but it was odd to be reaching over a foot to get to my light and clock. there is no clock in the room by the way! i do not understand why the frosted glass walls for the bathroom are a good idea. it may make the room feel bigger but i don't need to see someone's feet in the shower OR their whole body if they forget to use the magic glass! the coffee maker and cups were up on a high shelf so i had trouble reaching them and then the instant coffee was horrible anyway. not worth the effort... i have never been able to use the pool at this hotel but i hear it's nice. this is part of the reason i booked here again but when i found out about the fireworks show on saturday night, that took priority over the pool :-)

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectation”
Reviews.Author: asiaopinionleader
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in this hotel. First the positive things. The indoor pool, the gym, the executive lounge are very nice, and can be rated above average for hotels within similar grade and price range. The problem however is the room, other than small, was very noisy from the air conditioning (either duct or whole system for the floor?). The maid service is inconsistent - most days they did not clean (e.g., vacuum the bathroom or replace supplies to include toilet paper!). I had to call the front desk for the maid to come after I returned to the room in the evening. The location is not the most convenient comparing to some similarly priced nearby hotels. The multiple front steps at the hotel entrance, a curvy junction of two roads without traffic lights, is quite dangerous - one cannot see oncoming traffic, and travelers with children should be extra careful. All in all, for a short stay, if you get a reasonable price, I would recommend it. Beyond three nights stay, I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: SareyW
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in a city view room for 3 nights. I had read reviews that said the rooms were tiny and uncomfortable, but whilst fairly compact, we found the room to be large enough to accommodate us and all of our luggage. The room was quiet, had great air con, lots of little extras and was spotlessly clean. What we liked the most was the location in Kowloon - right in the middle of the action, the large comfortable bed and the great value for money this hotel gave. The only things I have to say against the hotel are that our room wasn't serviced on the second day and the hotel staff spoke very little English which made it difficult to get advice. However, we would absolutely stay again and would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Restful stop in a crazy town!”
Reviews.Author: Paul L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back from India. This htel provided all the luxury and relaxing environment you'd need! I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Small room though very big television”
Reviews.Author: ykhppc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on a staff incentive trip. When first stepped into the room, noticed that it was very small though the level we stayed were in the Empire Club level. The closet provided hardly can fit in all my clothes, the depth is less than 10 cm. However, the only thing that attracted my attention is that the TV is so large that when I laid on my bed, I found that it was too big that I need to turn my head slightly to catch the running lines on the news. Room services is only available from 0600 hrs to 2330 hrs. Internet cost HK$40/hr or HK$120/day. Staff were relatively indifferent at times, perhaps due to the large number of guests during this summer period where sales are abundant. We need to walk about 10-15 mins to the nearest MTR though taxis are readily available in Hong Kong. For the price of the hotel, I think I'll rather stay at another hotel with a slightly bigger room and much nearer to the MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and average decorated but not near to MTR”
Reviews.Author: AlexKhoo
Reviews.Content: It is a typical hotel that you could stay for a holiday trip to Hong Kong. You can smell stench from cigarette smoke in the hotel but not in the room. The room is small but clean and tidy. Although it is quite a long walking distance from either Tsim Sha Tsui or Jordan MTR station, there are a variety of shops along the way to keep you entertained well up to midnight!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Kevin1111111111111
Reviews.Content: We liked the location. We did not like the size of these rooms. Our room was booked by a travel agent and they obviously did not read the reviews. Most of the reviews seem negative. My wife stubbed her toe on the bed because the rooms are like a closet. You can not even fit your suitcase next to the bed. The service was atrocious. The maid smoked in our room while they were cleaning the room. We came back to a room filled with smoke. They made me come down to the lobby and put a deposit down face to face to get an internet cable. I told them that this was horrible customer service and they replied that it was their policy. If you don't care about the size of the rooms and you are used to poor service and you want to be nickled and dimed for everything then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Barely adequate for its rating”
Reviews.Author: asagao
Reviews.Content: While centrally located in the Tsim Sha Tsui area of Kowloon, and presenting a pretty public face, the aging mechanical and electrical systems (read internet connection, plumbing and air-conditioning) reveal themselves in many uncomfortable ways. We stayed in a standard room with twin beds and were initially impressed with the way the interior designers had shoe-horned every necessity in the typically tiny space, A lot of translucent glass (including the door to the bathroom) was involved in giving guests an illusion of space. However, that could not disguise the extra-narrow luggage shelf (don't even think of bringing anything but carry-on size) nor make-up for the lack of a simple eye-level ledge (in the petite shower stall) for holding shampoo/bath gel etc. One had to stoop to the floor to use these items. My techie husband immediately complained about the "antiquated" internet connection. I was more concerned by the unresponsive air-conditioning controls---the temperature indicator stubbornly displayed 22 degrees C even after repeated attempts to change it to a more reasonable 25C. The beds sagged. The second day (of our three-day stay), the toilet flush mechanism failed and was not attended to after a four-hour interval. The staff offered us a new room (after 10:00 p.m.) and sent a porter to help us move. The identically sized new chamber had other problems, however. The internet connection somehow would not connect---but kudos to the desk staffer who came up to the room and did something to make it work---although this took up almost an hour. (They did not charge us for the last two days of internet.) The air-conditioning was again rather slow to change temperatures, and the beds sagged even more uncomfortably. On the plus side---the rooms were kept clean (although one morning they failed to wash our used tea cups) and the sound-proofing was good---no traffic noise from outside, no sound leaks from adjoining rooms. Also, the corridors were covered in cheerful, geometrically patterned carpeting. We opted for the buffet breakfast on our last morning---a mistake. Not up to the quality and variety in similarly priced hotels in Hong Kong. Oh, the concierge gave me the wrong screening times for a movie... Overall, a hotel we would not return to. We can do better for the same price range at many other hotels in the same area of HK. We only tried it because it was included in a Dragonair package. (The airline is good---but that's another matter.)

Reviews.Title: “Great base for HK shopping”
Reviews.Author: Eire-ette
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice for shopping trips and while the rooms are small, its a great location & price for using as a base. Cleanliness, booking, check in, check out etc all perfect & they store luggae for you on last day no problem. Even the ilttle bar was good from which you can also get coffee & cheesecake in the afternoon. From here its easy to get the subway to the Mong Kok area (aka camera shop central). Last time we used Star Ferry also very easy from here but the subway is so brilliant and air conditioned and so cheap about 54p for 4 stops!

Reviews.Title: “I always end up at the Empire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenny888
Reviews.Content: This isn't my first time to stay at the Empire Hotel and it probably won't be the last either. The over-all service is not bad but neither is it exceptional. Checking in and out may sometimes be a problem due to the many people in the queue but the front desk personnel try to go about their business in a brisk manner. Best service goes out to the guy assigned at the concierge desk, as he is the most helpful, even going so far as to look up a certain address for me when I asked about a store I needed to go to. The room is quite small, as most hotel rooms are in Hong Kong, but it's clean which is what's more important for me. There's enough closet and drawer space for clothes and a small refrigerator for drinks. There's a desk and a chair which you can use should you be inclined to do some work and they have internet in the rooms but I find this too cost prohibitive. Suggest you purchase a PCCW card at the local 7-11 shops. The bed is quite comfortable and the pillows soft. Bottled water as well as the coffee and tea making facilities are replenished daily. Bathroom has the usual amenities in it and these too are replenished daily. Although the bathroom is not cramped, considering your hotel room is small, I don't like it that there is no place for you to put your toiletries on while you're in the shower. All you have is a small ledge (if you can call it that) on the floor and putting your toiletries there while you shower is just gross. Over-all I think the reason I go back to the Empire Hotel, aside from its clean rooms and decent service, is its location. I like that it's very near the shopping area (Granville) as well as the shopping malls which I frequent, I love that the subway station is close by should I feel like exploring other areas (tip: buy an Octopus card), I enjoy the walk from the hotel to my favorite coffee shop, I find comfort that the convenience stores are close by and that the Knutsford Steps, where I usually end up eating and drinking is literally just steps away from the hotel. Lastly, I like that the bus stop for the airport express shuttle is right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A MAZING!”
Reviews.Author: lou2287
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here. We stayed for 5 nights and really enjoyed they comfortable, clean and spacious room. Room service was pretty good, even late at night when we first arrived. We had fresh toiletries every day and the bathroom was really big. Have recommended my parents to stay there on their trip and would recommend to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & worth for money”
Reviews.Author: SharmiAmir
Reviews.Content: Its in Kowloon area & walking distance to shopping malls. Very convenient to get food supply as there's a sundry shop opposite the hotel. Clean toilet and room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: jonbowen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights over Chinese New Years. The location was perfect for exploring Hong Kong. After taking the train from the airport ,we hopped on the free shuttle to the hotel. Getting to the hotel could not have been easier. We loved the comfortable bed and the rainfall shower. The rooms are small but no worse than some of the rooms we have stayed in around Europe. The desk staff were cold but efficient. The walls were thin and the hallways echo like crazy. We were lucky we had quiet neighbors. For the price, $100/night, It was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great location but small room”
Reviews.Author: smark0980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December and the front desk staff were very helpful. The concierge service was good. However, the room was small and we did not find the room clean. The open concept (like a see through glass window inside the bathroom) was not good since we had teenagers with us (guess it is good for a couple wiht no children). The location is just perfect since you can walk to everywhere, however, the drop off from the shuttle bus was a little odd. Since the shuttle bus just abruptly stopped on the road and the driver announced the hotel so fast and sudden (we speak Chinese and still had a hard time to know that we just arrived at the hotel) that we had to react fast to get up and got off the bus. We had breakfast at 7:00am in the morning and I would say that I had seen the most slow moving Hk workers (we noticed that people in Hk are efficient and fast pace) that morning (maybe it is too early in the morning). The food was great but the restaurant service was sub-standard.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!!”
Reviews.Author: Fred_8184
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire hotel for 5 nights. After reading some of the reviews on here I was a bit worried about what I'd find when we arrived. Yes the room was quite small but it was to be expected in Hong Kong. There was plenty of rooms to put 2 large suitcases, and 3 cabin size bags. The bathroom was quite small but otherwise it was quite reasonable and comfortable! I'd also seen comments saying that it was too far from public transport. I didn't think it was too far at all being around a 10 minute walk - which didn't even feel like 10 minutes! The staff spoke english fairly well although we did have some troubles checking in and getting people into the correct room as some of us needed double beds and others needed single beds. This was just a problem when we were trying to receive an incoming call as they kept putting the call through to our friends room. Overall I'd say this was a good place to stay and would recommend friends to stay as long as they don't expect large rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: scootermanEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here both on our outward journey and return journey from Australia and would stay here again without doubt. The location is central for everything ,always taxis available as they line up in the side street as they cannot wait outside the hotel owing to it being on a corner location. Breakfast was a pleasure as there is virtually anything you want and plentiful.The reception staff where always helpful and would try to accomadate you in any request you made ,yes I admit the rooms are getting a bit jaded ,but its a central located hotel ,and most people are only staying for short spells anyway ,and is still fine if you are staying for a bit longer, and yes wardrobe space is a bit limited but you cope.To sum up I would not hesitate to recomend this hotel and looking forward to staying here again next year ,as when you are on short stays you need to be central and can walk anywere from here ,and in an evening if you do not wish to dine in the hotel just stroll out and there are lots of restraunts and bars.The rooms are clean and complimentary drinking water is provided along with a room safe.

Reviews.Title: “would not choose empire hotel kowloon again”
Reviews.Author: davewollongong
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Empire Hotel and was allocated a room on 9th floor, did not expect such a small room, there was not enough room for my wife and i and our two travel bags, nowhere to store the bags, nowhere to hang your clothes, could be the smallest room I have ever been in. Went to the front desk and asked for an upgrade and was willing to pay for it and was given a room on the 22nd floor which was a reasonable size for an extra $40 a night, original package was pay for three and get the fourth night free, however, still had to pay the extra $40 for the fourth night. The hotel was clean although my wife stated that the toilet in the bar area was dirty, not good considering only guests were allowed to use it. the location of the hotel was not a problem, the staff were friendly and spoke reasonable english, the rooms were clean but our room had two airconditioning vents with one of them blowing directly over our bed which eventually gave me a head cold.

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: CYKL
Reviews.Content: As this was a business retreat with colleagues, I didn't have much of a choice on the accomodation. There is nothing wrong with this hotel, but I won't stay here again because of its terrible location. While the nearest station is Tsim Sha Tsui station, it is a good 15-min walk from one of the station exits. And taxis are not allowed to wait outside the hotel because the hotel is at a junction. Except for the location, the hotel is fine. The rooms were small but that was ok. Breakfast staff speaks adequate English. Conceige was knowledgeable. Hotel was clean, oh but there's no toilet except in your room, and at the lounge where you need an access card from the staff, and at the restaurant where you also need an access card from the staff. I would think it is fair to expect an access card to prevent non-hotel guests from using the toilets, but shouldn't the toilets also accept room access cards somehow?

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: delmac71
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Empire, Kowloon about 10 times in the last 3 years. Rooms are modern, location is great for TST subway and Nathan Rd (5/10 min walk). Efficient check-in/check-out service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: The_traveling_gypsy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on wotif.com and got a very reasonable price. I feel it was well worth what I paid. The room was quite small, however it was clean, nicely air-conditioned, had a fantastic view over the city and harbour (although we were on the 25th floor), and had black-out curtians, making sleep-ins and daytime naps very easy. The location was quite convenient, in the middle of town, an easy walk to the metro and maybe a 15 minute walk to the harbour. The hotel service was very good and the staff were helpful and informative, speaking fantastic English! The tour desk helped us choose a tour and we were picked up from the front door. I have already recommended a friend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Overall positive”
Reviews.Author: naYumi
Reviews.Content: I stayed 10 days with a friend in a twin-room and I had an overall positive experience. In the beginning I was a bit anxious as I found quite a lot negative comments regarding this hotel, but in the end I might conclude that staff was friendly and rooms were indeed small, but always clean. The location is definitely perfect if you like to take the boat or just cross to HK island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mee7877
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very conveniently located in tsim sha tsui. Great for shopping and not far from MTR station. Hotel staff will try to assist you as well as they can, but not all staff are fluent in english. Rooms are small but well fascillitated and cleaned daily. Airconditioning is manageable in room, but room will never be colder dan 19 C. No free internet :( and the computers available at Zinos caffe are verry slow and with old software. At first internet was free if consuming a drink, midweek it became at cost for 30HKD for 30 min. Not worth it at all. Free internet availlable in Paccific Coffee neearby at nathan road.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Rupeng
Reviews.Content: My family is frequent (twice or thrice a year) travellers to Hong Kong stayed in a few regular hotels. This is the first time that we stayed in Empire Hotel Kowloon. Booked 3 rooms (twin-sharing) from 17 Jun to 20 Jun 2010. Emailed Reservation Office 7 days prior to departure requesting for connecting or adjoining rooms on non-smoking floor. Reservation Supervisor's replied that rooms will be ready upon our arrival in the afternoon. (1) We arrived at 3pm and only 1 room was ready! Receptionist made us wait for the remaining 2 rooms to be ready so that she can issued 3 card keys together. I insisted that she lets us have 1 room to put our luggage and freshen up. We will collect the 2 keys at night after we came back from dinning and shopping at night. She reluctantly agreed. (2) Upon our return to hotel at night, I requested for the 2 rooms card keys by providing the rooms number. Night duty staff looked at us suspiciously and demanded that I produced our Passport to verify. Verifications took a long time. We were all very tired and yet have to suffer such attitude/anguish from counter staff. Conclusion: Checking-in was very slow and there is counter staff is cold. What happen to SERVICE WITH A SMILE

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThienThao
Reviews.Content: I highly appreciate this hotel about location. i traveled long time ago in Hongkong, so i knew where we could walk around nicely, easily. For my honeymoon, i choose this hotel to spend our sweetest. When we check in, we got some problem with reception but it did not mind about that. And when receptionist know our honeymoon vacation, they gave us some soft drink and sweet words, so amazing. There is nice view in our room, we could see around view of that hotel they built wonderful. However, one thing did not make me happy, it is wireless internet, it is not available at this hotel. If we want we could pay expensive fees in there. But i could recommend for you one place nice for connect internet wireless to work. Turn right from this hotel and find a small coffee shop ( Korean coffee shop), you could pay only 20$ HK dollars for one coffee cup and enjoy your working time. For me, this hotel is the best staying in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend”
Reviews.Author: mgershenson
Reviews.Content: With all the choices in Hong Kong, I cannot recommend this hotel. As a previous review said, the location is not very convenient for reaching the MTR. When I arrived it was raining, and the 2 doormen made no move to come down to help me with my bags, although they stood there and watched me carry them up the stairs. Check in was easy, room is OK. Small, but that's expected. I asked for, and confirmed, a non smoking room. Maybe they meant that no one was smoking at the moment, but that obviously wasn't the case yesterday since the place smelled like an ahstray. Although several times through the night I smelled smoke coming from the A/C, so maybe it was imported and not local. I hate to sound like one of 'those people', but too damn bad. I asked for a non smoking room, I don't want to smell smoke, period. internet connection is 120 for 24 hrs which is OK, except that it times out constantly so you have to log back in every 10 minutes or so. Speed is good. The whole place is OK, but just doesn't seem to go that extra inch like others I've stayed at in HK. I would rate Langham place, Holiday Inn golden Mile, or L'Hotel Tin Hau much, much higher than this place. Even the Nathan was friendlier, better service and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “tyring trip”
Reviews.Author: gujrani
Reviews.Content: hii,hotel is nice but it is far from mtr,in hongkong if u need to go anywhere u need mtr so it should be nearby....u need to walk a lot

Reviews.Title: “cold staff, but good location”
Reviews.Author: cola-wkl
Reviews.Content: We were early that day for check in, the reception girl was cold and slow. We finally got our keys but found the carpet in our room dirty, we requested for a new room and the hotel was again, very slow. The hotel is located perfectly, walking distance to shopping areas and subways, you may follow the way down and find a restaurant named A So? which offers very good steak. Oh by the way no free internet is available, sad!

Reviews.Title: “Robotic Reception Staff but generally modern hotel with small rooms and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelhk
Reviews.Content: Staff can be robotic and unhelpful. Generally adequate hotel for reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Cross referenced when checking out!”
Reviews.Author: Shane_Sabrina
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here and selected the hotel because of price and location. We had read some of the reviews on here about the staff being non responsive, however we were happy to accept that as the price was good. The hotel was easy to find, we got the train from the airport, then we boarded the free shuttle bus that took us straight to the door. At the check in we were greeted by a friendly member of staff named 'kenny' and he was most helpful and polite. The rooms were small and basic, but we were only staying for 2 nights on our way to Australia, so they were adequate, if we had been staying for any length of time, it may have proved a struggle. There was a well stocked and overpriced mini bar, so we emptied it and bought our own provisions from the nearby 7/11 - (It is 2 minutes walk from the hotel) Be aware there is a huge 24hr brothel across the road, so the location may or may not be for you - however the area was not seedy and no one was lurking around the place. When we left we put all the minibar items back in the fridge, however the man on reception said we had drank a beer - after 10 minutes of cross referencing us, he finally accepted that we had not - and we just managed to get our deposit back and get the shuttle bus back to the train station - it was a poor ending to an adequate stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: kathrynfeng
Reviews.Content: Book through Agoda got a very reasonable price. The Pros: The location is very good. 5 minutes walk to Mira Shopping Complex, Nathan Road, Cameroon Road. 10 minutes walk to Harbour City Shopping Complex and MRT Station. The hotel room and toilets are clean. Air conditions is cold and many varities of TV programme. The Cons: Breakfast are lousy, not many choices and its repeated daily. Check out Strictly at 12.00 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Not A bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mossad0
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. The room is small. Well, with this location, what can we get! The services are not bad, the doorman are very helpful and polite. Location is good, so convenience. I grew up is this city, for me is very good. The only think I don't quiet like that is no complimentary internet. Other than that, I gave this hotel 80 of 100. I will continue to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vicpk
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here, the views over Hong Kong were amazing, just make sure you get a room up high away from the construction site next door. The room was clean, well maintained, and for an older hotel, it is well kept. The only down side was the poor service from ther tourist desk. Reception, bell boys and door men were excellent. Everything is within walking distance. just get the free map from the tourist desk and get out and explore! Just ignore the people on each corner selling fake watches and new suits.

Reviews.Title: “The price is alluring, but I would pay more to stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: BXG824
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by stating I have stayed in Hong Kong hotels regularly for the past 10 years. I have seen a lot of old hotels polish themselves up to nicer quality hotels, and I have seen a lot of reputable hotels lose some of their posh. I had only heard of the Empire in passing, but recently received a recommendation from a colleague who said he stayed at the Empire and that they had recently renovated their rooms - and the price was right. So - I tried it. Never ever again. #1. You need to climb approximately 8 steps from the sidewalk to the entrance of the hotel. Upon arriving at the hotel with 4 large suitcases between me an my colleague, no one came outside to help us carry our bags up to the entrance. I actually had to go inside and request help. #2. Although I had requested a "new" room, I was given the key to an old room w/ a rattling air con system and 2 hooks that were supposed to resemble a closet. Mind you, I was staying for 2 weeks and needed some place to put my clothes. I went to the front desk to request a new room. After about a half hour of discussion, I received a transfer to a new room. #3. My new room was indeed new, with hardwood floors and a quieter a/c unit. However, the floors were covered w/ dust, as were the tables and lamps. #4. The rooms are so small you cannot open your suitcase unless you place it on your bed. Keeping the dusty floors in mind, you don't want to take a suitcase you just rolled on the floor and place it on your bed. #5. The rooms completely lack normal conveniences - like an alarm clock, or complimentary water. #6. Even though it was cooler outside, I needed to sleep w/ the a/c on set to the warmest setting. Throughout the night I would wake up because the stench of cigarettes was so overwhelming - coming into my room through the air vents. It was truly disgusting. #7. The halls are tiled w/ marble and the bedroom has hardwood floors. But this means there is absolutely no sound absorption. I was about 100 feet from the elevator - around a bend and far down the hall - and I could hear the elevator bell ring every time it arrived on my floor. I could hear my neighbors talk, doors open and close --- sound really travels here. I would wake up nightly around 4am from doors slamming. #8. The lounge - don't even get me started. There is 1 bartender who works at the lounge every night. Good luck getting waited on. She doesn't speak much English - which is the same to be said about the rest of the hotel staff. If you think you are going to the hotel lounge for a relaxing drink be prepared to sit and wait and wait and wait - even if you are the only one in the bar. #9. The breakfast buffet is sub-par compared to other hotels. The food is mostly cold - no matter what time you go to the buffet. I've been there at 7am and at 9:30 am - and the food is cold. The staff slams the dishes around when clearing tables or replenishing buffet plates -- the noise of the staff far outweighs the noise of the diners. This is not good. It makes for a tense, uncomfortable space. Plus, there are waiters wandering around, but they do not refill coffee or tea - just walk around. #10. The internet requires you go to the front desk and sign out a modem. This is so archaic. Then they charge you $30HKD per half hour. The price was really outlandish. #11. The selection of tv channels is slim. If you want English TV you are relegated to Natgeo and discovery. Sometimes BBC and MSNBC - but that it is. No HBO. #12. They state they have a gym... but it was under construction when I was there. I was redirected to a room on teh 23(?) floor which had 3 pcs of equipment that Jane Fonda may have found suitable in 1982. #13. The doorman on duty watches you as you open your own door to exit or enter the building. I am completely befuddled as to what his purpose is. #14. One night around 11pm it sounded like someone was using an electric saw - as in doing construction in the building. It lasted around 20 minutes - to be followed by random banging, etc. #15 On another day, the "flushing water" - for the toilet - was turned off for 12 hours. The strangest part was that I received a "flushing water service resumed" notice just as it was turned off. You can imagine my confusion. #16 - not that I was looking to take a swim - but the pool was drained dry. If you have any sense of standards when traveling, this is not the hotel for you. To be truly honest, it was comparable to most "Mainland China" hotels that you find in more remote locations. The staff was not your typical Hong Kong staff of knowledgeable service industry professionals. If I had not prepaid for the "extended stay special" rate, i would have relocated to a new hotel. I guess the saying holds true - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Still ok!”
Reviews.Author: Raymond_Mal
Reviews.Content: I went to stay there with my wife to celebrate our honeymoon in July. First of all, we didn't expect much on this hotel the reason is we just transfer from a terrible hotel which located nearby. Something good is room is clean & the most important is the located nearby those place which can let my wife shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel at the right price”
Reviews.Author: nikki_eatworld
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Hong Kong is extremely expensive but after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor about Empire Kowloon, I decided to book it. For the cost and location, this hotel is perfect. Modern decor, great location (not far from public transportation/subway), lots of places to eat and drink nearby. The room is small but that is common in a city as densed as Hong Kong. I highly recommend staying on the Kowloon side if you're on a budget. The service staff was accommodating when we came back and tried to get a room again at the hotel (after our connecting flight to Bangkok was cancelled). Empire hotel serves a lot of group tours so don't be surprise to wait a while at the reservation desk to check-in.

Reviews.Title: “ok, I guess!”
Reviews.Author: Imlabella
Reviews.Content: The location was breat, but the room was small. I didnt have a reservation, so Im sure u can get a better deal online that I did. I paid about $125usd for a single room. The hotel doesnt have much to do, it´s mostly for t hose want to go shopping n dont plan to say in the hotel much time.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good scrub”
Reviews.Author: AnneLV
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, I booked through the Hong Kong tourist agency and got a great rate for one night. (The office at the Star Ferry terminal connected me using their phone - very helpful.) When I went to see the hotel, immediately after I booked at 10:30 am, they suggested I check in. Since a room in my booked class wasn't ready, I was upgraded to a suite on the top floor. Very roomy with amazing views. Two flat screens, lovely bedding, bathrobes, limited mini-bar. But really could use a good scrub. The rub was appallingly dirty (foot tracks), dust everywhere (like the room hadn't been touched in awhile), divan and ottoman in living room had quite visible dark stains, and the tile and grout was not in good shape. As an aside: there was no alarm clock. Agree with the comment about staff: they mill around but you must drag your own bags up the marble steps into the hotel - in full view of said staff. Still, I enjoyed the location, comfy bed, amazing views, and anonymity.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Anna-37-511
Reviews.Content: I have been staying to this hotel 3 x. This August was my 4th and last stay at their hotel. My whole bag was stolen. Imagine It was stolen at their own Restaurant. Beware as this is the worst experience I had with them considering I am loyal to them every time I go there since December 2007. Their amenities were not the same the first till third time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel and rude unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TheCollies
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in 2005 and had a good experience. As this time we were travelling with an infant we thought we would stay in a place we knew.... boy were we wrong! When we arrived at the hotel we were asked to sign the paperwork for our stay which gave our room rate along with with a statement that the 10% room tax was included. The receptionist then crossed this out and said it didn't apply anymore and it was an issue with the computer system and we had to pay this on top. Needless to say this was not the start we were hoping for. We were then given our room and told that we had been upgraded to a bigger room as we had a cot to put in the room. The room was such a funny shape that we could not fit the cot in, it had a tiny window which you could not see out of and therefore made a room on the 16th floor feel like the basement and then on top of this the carpet was coming up, the wall paper coming off the walls etc. My husband went to reception to ask for a new room and was told that nothing was available despite the fact they were still checking people in. I then went down and after a protracted 'discussion' with reception was shown a smaller but much nicer room that we could actually fit the cot in. The rest of our trip was much the same with dour unhelpful staff. We would certainly not recommend this hotel to anyone, even those on a budget and were very dissapointed after our experiences last time.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Kurosaki_Ichigo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located just off the main Nathan Road. Good restaurants like Fook Lam Moon and Chuk Yuen (not to mention your very own Ben and Jerry's!) are on the same street. Tsim Sha Tsui Station very accessible, and you can also take a walk to various attractions, from the Avenue of the Stars and 1881 Heritage, or even the Temple Street Night Market in the other direction. The room, though mostly clean, was quite cramped. Pillows were too soft for our liking. Housekeeping tends to be slow, and often forgets to replenish the instant coffee and toiletries. Thermostat is a little hard to figure out initially. The staff at the reception/concierge helped when asked. But otherwise nothing remarkable about the service.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic service.”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidSydney
Reviews.Content: Staff are falling over each other at reception but no one can help you with any thing. This swarm of beautifully attired receptionists watched us struggled up the stairs with our luggage into the hotel foyer. Their English was appalling. The pool (indoor) is at artic temperature. We were told to go to the pool in our bathrobes however there were none in our room. When asked for one we were told that not every room has them and we should go down the lift in our towels. The change room near the pool was closed. The room was tiny - smaller than the hotels we had just stayed at in Europe. The hallways have a musty smell even though the hotel is quite new. Disappointing in every way. On the plus side the breakfasts were great. Fresh food of every type (from pastries to bacon and eggs and more) was replenished constantly. The position was good. Up the road is a street of well priced restaurants. Unfortunately they were all international cuisine - not one chinese! Definately wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: heidzilu
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked this hotel just a few minor things I didn't like. I liked that the hotel is conveniently located, not a far walk to the subway and good places to eat nearby. We got a room with a view of the harbour so we can watch part of the Harbour Light Show at 8:00 PM. It's a close walk from the hotel to the harbour near Avenue of the Stars. The cleaning lady was very nice. The room is quite small. I didn't like the shower because water would leak out of the door and you step into a puddle of water when you walk out of the shower. I've tried to move the shower head to different angles and positions and still got a puddle of water. The TV is mounted on the wall so it's uncomfortable to sit up to watch TV, you have to lie in bed. I suppose the wall mounting is due to lack of space in the room. But this hotel came as part of a package deal that we got a really good deal on so I can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “good price rooms are small but you don't stay in rooms but to sleep”
Reviews.Author: GlenyssAustralia
Reviews.Content: we are a family of mum dad and two boys ages 10 and 13 and we just stayed two nights in the Empire Hotel Kowloon. We the train from the airport HK$220 they had some family deal to the bus terminal and then a free bus took us to the hotel which was great a K4 bus. The train was efficient and quick and easy to understand. We had booked the hotel through WOTIF and got a good deal with breaky included but we had to get two rooms and they weren't able to do them next to each other only on the same floor. I had requested non smoking rooms and particuarly for my son who has allergies well I wish I had said it was all of us who had allergies as the room they gave us with the beds for the kids smelled awesome but our room smelled like smoke got used to it after a little while but it hit you when you walked into the room. The breaky was nice and good choices. Tea and coffee are never good in places like that just have to live with that. I would stay closer to Mong Kok next time as that is closer to the ladies market and temple street as we did walk to both of those but it was a long walk in the heat with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTara
Reviews.Content: The Empire was comfortable and inviting. We arrived on the Friday of a long weekend and the hotel was very busy. We got a great deal on two consecutive nights with a city view room. Not much to see out the window as we were on the 16th floor but, you could barely see across the harbor to Hong Kong island, so that was nice. The room was small but expected as I heard that many of the rooms in HK are small. Free coffee and tea in room along with a bar fridge. The bathroom had a wall fixture in the shower for shampoo/conditioner/soap all in one. Not sure how that's supposed to work out but bring along some conditioner if you prefer it than 3 in one. The tv was functioning with quite a few English channels and the internet is not free, so don't count on that. It's $40/hr or $120/24 hrs. Our bathroom door was not functioning well as it was a sliding door and once I got stuck inside and needed help opening the door to get out. Also the light fixture in the shower was hanging out of it's socket which I thought was quite dangerous. The hotel has a strange lighting system I suppose to save energy. You must insert your room card in order for the lights to work. In the night our closet light would not turn off so we had to remove the key altogether which then turned on the automatic air conditioning system. We woke up in the morning not feeling well because of it. The safe was functioning. Two robes were supplied along with two pairs of slippers. We indicated that two people would be using the room. The towels were all clean and fluffy. The floor didn't look exquisitely clean so we didn't wear bare feet at all in the room or in the shower. Overall, I'd stay again at this hotel and recommend it to a friend. A good deal for a decent room. Oh, forgot to mention.. GREAT LOCATION!! Walking distance to Nathan Road and many nice places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Room very small and basic.”
Reviews.Author: Kilmacloo
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple with a one year old child and we were travelling with a party of 13 pax attending a wedding in Australia. We had booked a double room with a cot for our child. When we were shown to our room, we were shocked at the size of the room. There was only one step from the bed to the ensuite and one step on the otherside of the bed. At this stage we couldnt figure out where our luggage would go or the cot for our child. We went down to reception and asked if there was a bigger room and told that they didn't. I said that we wouldnt be able to move in the room. So they offered a twin room. The room was a bit bigger and we could push the twin beds together which gave a bit more room for our child to move around on the floor. The cot came up and I was very small, I have seen children toy cots as big. So our 1 year old stayed with us in the bed. We had one window which was up nearer at the top of the wall, which didnt allow much natural sun light in. The beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was very good and an excellent choice. The bar did not allow any child (which was not advertised) so if we wanted a drink we had to sit outside the bar area. One of the other parties travelling with us booked a triple room, which was just the standard twin room with a roll in bed squashed into a cornor. Again they found the room very confined. One of the other party had a suite, which to european standards and standard double room, they had fanastic vues. The Hotel was very central to everything which was great. I wouldnt recommend the hotel to families. But I am sure any businness person would be happy with the facilities This hotel is not suited for the

Reviews.Title: “Must go back!”
Reviews.Author: maraljo
Reviews.Content: We had just 2 nights here,on a stopover from Australia back to the UK and it really wasn't long enough to appreciate not just Hong Kong but also this hotel. I had read some adverse comments on this site and was pleasantly surprised from the moment we arrived at the hotel at 10 p.m. We were welcomed by the reception staff, our luggage was whisked away and we were ushered to one of the 4 lifts (all of which worked perfectly). The concierge and his team were all extremely polite and helpful as was the young lady who helped us to choose appropriate tours. Yes, the bedrooms are quite small but well-equipped and very clean. You have to remember that HK isn't a very big place so they have to cram a lot of buildings into a small area.. The breakfasts are very nice, a good selection buffet-style and everywhere in the hotel is so clean . It's about 10 minutes ambling time to walk to Nathan Road where you can find the most amazing bargains and about another 10-20 minutes to make your way down to the waterfront (depending on how many shops you look/gawp at AND how many Indian gentlemen accost you with promises of 'real' Gucci/Vuitton/Rolex etc). We found that to be the only downside to HK. When we go back we intend to stay at the Empire again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: kchung9209
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire Hotel at Kowloon from mid December 2008 to early January 2009. The size of the room was ok for the four of us (me, my wife and two small kids) but we did have some problems with the toilet. The toilet had to be fix twice on our 17 days stay. In addition, there are several steps fronting the hotel and no ramp so that each time I have to enter the hotel with my family, I have to take my child out of the stroller or carry my child along with the stroller up the stairs. But having said this, the service of the hotel staffs were excellent. When the front door bellmen were not busy with other customers they would help us carry my baby stroller up and down the stairs. Furthermore, they repair the toilet almost immediately after being report defective.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: klouie
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, and we were overwhelmed by the service they provided for us. The location was absolutely perfect because it was close to many restaurants and cheap shops that line just along kimberly, carnarvon road. The hotel facilities are good, and the staffs are very much helpful with whatever it is that you need. I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable Empire”
Reviews.Author: eeliechick
Reviews.Content: I work for a travel agency & stayed here as we contract this hotel. Taxi from the airport was $45 AUD & took about 45 minutes. The location was fantastic close to Tsim Sha Tsui Station & just off Nathan Road, we stayed at the Shangri-La also which was an amazing hotel however not in as good a location as the Empire. The room had a queen size bed, TV, desk, mini-bar and a good sized, modern bathroom. The next morning we had buffet breakfast at the hotel which was delicious and cost about $20 AUD per person. The room was small but this is expected in Hong Kong as land price is so expensive, the bed was not all that comfortable but we put up with it. The bathroom was modern and spacious we were supplied with plenty of toiletries including a toothbrush. The service from the porters was outstanding, and the foyer quite nice. You could notice a little wear & tear in the hallways however it was kept in quite good nick - I would rate it about 3 star. The price is excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and off the beaten road”
Reviews.Author: KevinTHM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Empire Hotel Kowloon for 3 nights with my wife. The hotel is a bit out of the way, quite a long walk from the nearest MTR (Jordan). It is also tucked away from the main shopping area. But, it is quite easy to find food as there are many restaurants around the area. The hotel was relatively new at that time, the rooms are luxurious but very small. For that room size, the room rate is considered quite high. Not much of a view as it is blocked by other high rise apartments and hotels around the area. You can only catch a glimpse of the harbour a distant away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: airren
Reviews.Content: I came here with my family and we had actually booked a standard room but when we arrived, we were given a nice surprise as we were upgraded to a deluxe room. The deluxe room was comfortable spacious and very impressive. Unfortunately I only had the good luck to stay here for two nights. This was a very lovely hotel indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Would go again.”
Reviews.Author: Aussies50
Reviews.Content: We (a couple both 50) have just spent 10 days at the Empire and while it is true that the rooms are small by western expectations, we found we adjusted very quickly and they are very serviceable. The area is a great place to base yourself for exploring Hong Kong as it is close to the MTR, buses and shops etc. There is a Welcome supermarket and 7-11 across the road, which both have cheap supplies for fruit, water and drinks. Staff and locals are friendly and helpful. We were out walking around at all hours and never felt uneasy safety wise. Nothing to do with the hotel but the area does have a lot of annoying Indian merchants who bug you as you walk around. Just ignore them. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but don't bring any luggage”
Reviews.Author: K_K_travellers
Reviews.Content: The location is a bit off the main road, but in an area that is not as commercial as in Nathan Road. We got a room on the 18th floor, modern and with a very nice view. The room, however, was very small, but had all the facilities that a traveller needs, apart from space. We were travelling with two medium sized suitcases and two trolleys. There were hardly any space to store the suitcases and trolleys. If you wanted to open them up, you had to put them on the bed. With heavy suitcases that is a lot of heavy lifting. Normally you would put what you needed for a couple of days in the cupboards. In the Empire there is not enough room in the cupboards for two people, hardly for one person. One nice tip about the location though is that is close to the Kimberly Steps and the arcade, which is across the Kimberly street, with a lot of nice restaurants. Would we stay there again. No! The quality is ok, but 'no' due to the location and the lack of space.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Eyeluv2Travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an excellent location - close to all activities in Hong Kong, restaraunts, shopping, and walking distance from the harbour. The rooms were very small, but from my research - this is common in Hong Kong. The rooms were clean, and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel but small room”
Reviews.Author: The_TravellerSg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in Dec 06 and compared to my stay here several years back, the hotel continue to upgrade itself which means it still look new and good. The rooms are extremely small and is considered expensive for this rate but if you like clean modern facilities, this is the hotel for you. Located close to Knustford Terrace (hype dining area) and with several eateries nearby, this hotel is good and the airport shuttle bus is just opposite the hotel. One of the better hotel along Kimberley Street and definitely better than Stanford Hillview which is close by too. On the same street, there is a new boutique hotel, Luxe Manor and futher up, there is also another small boutique hotel or should I say tech0hotel, Mingle Place, which I have also reviewed. No comments on the F & b establishement there as I never eat in hotels in HKG when you are spoilt for choice out of it. Adequate pool as well and this hotel is definitely recommended despite the small room as all you need is a clean nice hotel to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Clean”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastandrew
Reviews.Content: Good new modern and clean hotel. Rooms are a little small but have all the mod cons and are comfortable. There is an ok view towards the city. Location isn't the best as you have to walk a fair distance to get to the nearest subway stop. There is a good Japanese restaurant below and one of the best Peking Duck restaurants "Hong King" I have ever been to. It is just around the corner from the hotel. Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: SantaMonicaMax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire Hotel in Kowloon in August 2007 on the first leg of a four city tour of China. We have read about the small nature of the rooms, yes they are small but not so small to denigrate the stay at the hotel. We never had a problem with the rooms but someone with restricted mobility might have problems. There was around 4 feet or so space around the bed so that should be ample for most people. Hong Kong is such a bustling city we spent most of our time outside the hotel anyway!! The rooms are fine and the floor to ceiling windows ensure you have a great view wherever your room is situated within it. One thing that definitely impressed us was the great breakfast every morning and the lounge bar on the mezzanine level. The food was great (the best hotel food we had in our 4 city tour) and the bar was a comfortable place to relax in the early evening before hitting out to sample the sights and sounds of the city at night. The internet access was free in the lounge bar as long as you had a drink at the same time. Compared to the rest of China this was great as internet access elsewhere was ridiculously expensive. As I mentioned the location is great, loads of museums nearby and it's a short walk to the water front / Tsim Sha Tsui subway station. The staff were friendly and efficient. They even made breakfast for us on the last day we were there when we missed breakfast by 15 mins. All in all a great hotel and one I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, many tours ...”
Reviews.Author: geronimoturtle
Reviews.Content: The hotel in a good location for the MTR, ferry etc but our room was very small and the bathroom was even smaller. Good shower and heatlamp though. Broadband was not free. The beds were lovely and soft after many weeks of hard beds in mainlaind China. There are steps into the hotel and no ramp to get your luggage up and no-one even attempted to help us or bother to open the door for us. Breakfast buffet was very chaotic and the aircon was freezing. We came back to collect our luggage which the hotel had stored and there was no room to sit in reception so we sat in the pool area until it closed, when we moved to the bar. This was nice and bright and had good street views to people watch and pass the time. The bar area was very dark. Many packagage tours stay here. Won't stay here again, the hotel looks much nicer from it's website than it really is. Next time we visit HK we will stay on HK island and not Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Shoppers Paradise”
Reviews.Author: dannii52
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was fine overall, it was over the Chinese New Year so lots of things were closed and there didnt seem to be as many people as we had expected. The hotel is great for location,right near several MTR stations and the main road for shopping. The room was clean and very welcoming, with a good size bathroom and shower. The bar in the lobby also has 2 laptops which you can surf the net on, they do ask that you buy a drink first though. Our view from the room was ok, apart from the smog which we cant blame the hotel for, it looked straight over the harbour. The only problem we had was one day we decided to relax in our room because of the lack of attractions being open and the housekeeping actually asked us to leave the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but not the best!”
Reviews.Author: graemeboro
Reviews.Content: This was be to the destination for my Honeymoon so naturally we wanted it to be good but unfortunately it could have been better. We got to the hotel after a 13 hour flight and a bit of detour when the taxi driver took us to the wrong hotel. The confusion over Kimberly Road meant he dropped us at the Kimberly Hotel about a 100 yards away. The outside of the hotel is quite tidy and the entrance hall and lobby is very smart and welcoming. We checked in and the receptionist seemed pleasant enough. My wife explained that it was our Honeymoon but the lady didn’t acknowledge – I think it was lost in translation. Most staff do speak basic English however it can be a bit of challenge to communicate. In saying that though we were in a Chinese speaking country and their English is far superior to my Chinese!!! We were initially booked into a room on the eight floor and the trip wasn’t too bad. The lifts were all very modern and clean and the place had a modern feel to it. The room however was disappointing. It was very small but the disappointment came with the view. We overlooked a load of very dirty buildings with rusty corrugated iron roofing. Not the fault of the hotel appreciated but still a grim view for a honeymoon. Having read some reviews on here prior to going out I got the idea that we could ask for a higher room with a harbour view. My wife spoke to reception and complained explaining that this was our honeymoon. We were told that these rooms charge a supplement and we couldn’t have one. After asking to speak to the manager we were then advised that there was a smoking room on the 21st floor and we could have it at no extra cost. We took it no questions asked. And what a difference it was! We had a clear view across to Hong Kong island very nice at night. Despite the view the room wasn’t that great, it was small and the windows hadn’t been cleaned in years. The worst thing however was the fact that we needed a maintenance man every night!! The first problem was a leak with the toilet. This was fixed but the fix meant the toilet took all night to fill after being flushed. Despite several people looking at this it was never resolved. The next night we came back only to find the key card didn’t work. I trekked all the way back down to reception to be met by a rather aggressive lady who was clearly annoyed at me being there and announced “there’s nothing wrong with this card!” I insisted she come and try for herself which she did and begrudgingly got the maintenance guy up again. It turns out that the battery pack in the reader had gone, so this problem was then fixed. The list doesn’t end there though, the next night we came back to find that the shower head was snapped, I can only assume that this was done during cleaning. Again the same maintenance man was sent who changed the shower head. That didn’t the fix the problem as wasn’t screwed in properly and went up and down according to the power. At this point we stopped reporting issues as we were embarrassed at the amount of times this guy need to visit! To be fair the maintenance man was there within ten minutes of the report every time but really should we have all these problems, or maybe it was just bad luck! Two things to avoid in this hotel are making calls from the phone; you get charged £4 just for ringing out and the breakfast. We had breakfast one morning and had four slices of toast between us and two cups of tea for a sum total of £10 what a rip off!! I also tried the pool which is very nice and clean but is ice cold so its not comfertable to use. The location of the hotel is excellent right in the centre of Tsim Sha Tsui. This hotel is a great base for exploring but if you want efficient hassle free accommodation maybe this is not the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for hotel location!”
Reviews.Author: morebang4buck
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern 4 star hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui. Close to MTR subway and Nathan Road. Lots of nice restaurants and trendy shops nearby, plus half block from Knutsford Terrace which has european restaurants and bars. Hotel has small rooms, expected in HK, a Japanase and Chinese restaurant, plus bar. Get a high room above 15 floor facing harbor views. Plenty of police everywhere in this area, so safety is not a problem. Internet is $40HK per hour or $120HK a day. All rooms have high ceilings, minifridge, desk, tv, free slippers and bath rob, and shower. Be sure to get money changed to HK dollars as hotel does not offer exchange services. Concierge was very helpful with local attractions and restaurants and hotel staff spoke excellent English. They can hold your luggage if you have late departure time and late check out is 2 p.m. There is a sauna, gym, indoor pool on 3rd floor. Free shuttle bus to airport across the hotel.
