We stayed during Chinese New Year at $880HK per night. As of January 1, 2007, there is no smoking in all HK hotels and restaurants, but smoking is still very noticable outside and in crowded areas on the street, as in most of China wherever you go. Most people speak English very well in HK so feel free to ask for directions if you get lost. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. Overall, very modern hotel, close to shops, restaurants, 7-11, and on quiet street away from heavy traffic on Nathan Road and MTR subway. This hotel is equivalent to a Doubletree hotel in U.S., but with smaller size rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: mahalo21
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as I liked what I saw online from the website showing pics of the rooms. I wasn't disappointed. Although it is a short walk from Tsimshatsui MTR, it is stil close to Nathan Road. There is a free shuttle bus K5 to the hotel if i'm not wrong and it is a 4-star hotel. The room no doubt is small but it is very cosy and really nice and classy decor. The bad thing was that the tv was hung up and your neck could get a little uncomfortable while watching tv. The bathroom was nice. There is also a mini gym and an indoor pool which I did not have a chance to use. This is a good place to stay if you like staying in TST area.

Reviews.Title: “Modernism Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jchen0
Reviews.Content: I was stay in HK and China for a week of business trip, spend two days of weekend and one night before I leave HK. My booking was standard room for HKD$850, price is ok for summer season in TST/HK. Because they are full when I arrived, so they upgrade me to "Empire Plus" which is bigger and oceanview room. See pictures, it's good, if you had money, try it. The price ISN'T inclued breakfast and internet, which is normal in TST/HK, but you can found lot of good Cantonese food in Kimberley Road (in fornt of hotel), tried congee and BBQ, taste good for me (one of restaurant had picture in menu), part of fun every morning. Their Pool is very good size, and design, it was in a courtyard of skyscraper, very smart design to mix out-door and in-door feeling. Must try. One bad thing is they allow smoking in lobby, and it feel very bad for me and I even can't sit in their Pub for 10 minutes. When I was back from China, to stay last night before my early fly from HK, I got my "Standard room", thanks from other TripAvidor's comment, it isn't surprise me for its small and look very modernism style bath room (if you call this size as a room...) Jacky Chen

Reviews.Title: “Small yet modern!”
Reviews.Author: boochi17
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about booking the Empire Kowloon after reading some reviews but decided on this hotel anyways because of the great location. I was not dissappointed. While in Hong Kong- it seems that you aren't in your room much anyways because the hotel is surrounded with shops and great places to eat at any time of the day. The room was quite small. My husband and I requested a non-smoking room with a single queen bed. You literally have enough room for your luggage and 2 people- but that really wasn't the problem. The room felt more cozy than cramped. The room also had a very nice modern spacious bathroom and the bedroom had built in furniture that conserved space but also gave you everything you could possibly need! The people who designed the room are pure genious using every nook and cranny for a purpose. The rooms are very modern with clean lines and the beds are quite comfortable. This is coming from a person who has trouble sleeping in hotels. The Concierge in the hotel was just wonderful- he recommended places for us to visit, told us about the best shopping areas, retaurants and MTR stops to go to and confirmed our flights for us. Days later he still remembered who we were and reminded us of the car service appointment he had made for us to the airport. We did not eat in the hotel- but we did try the breakfast buffet one morning. It was an average buffet with western breakfast foods but if it isn't included in your room price- it probably isn't worth it since they charge an equivalent to $14US. One block away from the hotel there are various restaurants that serve both chinese and western breakfast foods for a third of the price. The MTR station is about 4 blocks away from the hotel (depending on which direction you walk) and you are very close to the park, museums and major attractions of Kowloon which are also all in walking distance. Would I stay here again? Absolutely. It's hard to find a place that focuses on customer service and is clean and comfortable. I will make it a must on my next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: gund
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in mid May. I have rated above average as for the price i paid (abt HKD$700+ per nite), the quality of the hotel room and services have exceeded my expectations! I agree with previous commenters that the room is a little small so if you are of bigger built, you might not enjoy as much. The Good :) 1. (only if u appreciate a less busy area) Kimberley Road is a quieter street in the evening as the street is more known for housing bridal shops. Having stayed in a hotel @ Prat Avenue 4 nights before this hotel, it was truly a welcoming change (Prat Ave was a very busy street most times till past midnight!) 2. Service staff at reception and concierge were very professional and friendly. Their spoken english is good so no worries if you speak only english. 3. Honestly, i loved the room. For someone who can be quite particular about hotel room setting and cleanliness, you can almost take my word when i say it's truly value for money. I've stayed in other hotels in TST with just as good room but they usually are 20-40% costlier! 4. I managed to get a higher floor room so the view out of the window was a lot more attractive! Well, at least i didn't have to look into someone else's apt in the next building! 5. If you like Korean cuisine, there are several korean restaurants nearby. They must be quite good as I often see people queuing up outside the restaurants. 6. There is a wellcome supermarket and a 7-11 nearby so you can get some snacks and drinks at local prices The Bad :( 1. It is quite a distance to the nearest MTR exit at TST. Just treat it as your daily morning/evening exercise and you won't feel so bad afterall. 2. There is no ramp from the ground level to the hotel lobby entrance. If you have heavy luggage and if the concierge is too busy to help, you'll have to manage your stuff up/down the 5-8 steps. But not a big issue. 3. At Prat Ave (my previous hotel before Empire), i was only a very short distance to the nearest hawker snacks and main shopping area. Here at Kimberley, you have to walk a little bit more. 4. As mentioned, room is a little small. And i wished the TV was not built so high up. The best way to watch it was to lie in bed :( Despite the few negative points, I'd still return to Empire Kowloon if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here nov of 2005 after spending many hours looking at hotels on the internet, a 4 night stopover heading for OZ was very acceptable here, although we didnt make much use of the hotel facilitys we did find the gym very basic. price was ok, staff friendly enough, tour guide v helpful and so were door staff. hotel was nicely situated for us and we were able to get around wherever we wanted, star ferry to hong kong island only about a 10 min walk and underground just few mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it seems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I presume i just got a terrible room in this hotel. It's terribly small. It's a deluxe twin room and it has only enough room for 2 person. Not much view from the window as it's very small. Size of a cruise ship cabin window. The bathroom glass door almost look transparent. Not a good idea if guy and girl friend sharing the room. You'll even get to see the toile bowl with the glass door close. Felt totally decieved from what i see in the internet. Totally disappointed. Too disappointed to even take any pictures of the room. Will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, but there are better options”
Reviews.Author: archipelago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire Kowloon for three nights in early May, 2005. Previously we had stayed at the Kowloon Hotel. The Empire is not nearly as nice. While the design of the Empire had its attractions (lobby, bathrooms) overall we were disappointed. The room was small and dark. The bathroom, while beautifully designed, showed rust and failing caulking. The complicated wiring failed. We came back to our room after a nice evening out to find that we had no lights in our room. We had to prop the door open to let in light from the hall until someone arrived to fix the lights. Cable TV selections were limited except overpriced pay movies. There was no wireless Internet and they charged for in-room Internet access. Staff were quite helpful but not especially attentive. The buffet breakfast was pretty good but don't consider it unless it's included in with your room as it's vastly overpriced. If you want basic acommodations and can get a room there at a reasonable price the Empire is OK. Otherwise you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you can stand the small rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Empire Hotel Kowloon for 9 days in March, 2005. Never heard of this hotel before but the rates and facilities attracted my attention. Saw pictures of the rooms but in real life they are actually smaller than what they show in the photos. 2 persons is a maximum fit. If you have an extra kid, you may want to look elsewhere. The standard twin bed rooms are best for those who spend little time in the hotel and only use it for showers and some shut eyes. The carpets in the room needs a deep cleaning as they look pretty soiled. High speed internet is pricey and works only on TV. While on that subject, my room is not equipped with an LCD TV as shown in the "official" photos. However, once you factored in it's location, you tend to view it differently. The Empire Kowloon is located at the intersection of Kimberley and Observatory road. The former connects to Nathan road - all the subway and buses, the latter leads you to TST East by foot. Total convenience and every major hot spot like Mongkok, Central, Wanchai, Causeway Bay is only 2 to 3 stops from the hotel by subway. Plus there is a 7-11 store on BOTH streets, and laundry shops can be found aplenty with great rates in a small lane just behind the hotel. One more gripe - the pool is unheated. Even in March, the water is bone chilling cold. All in all, I still recommend this hotel if your intention is to shop till you drop in Hong Kong and a hotel that isn't too far away from where all the action is.

Reviews.Title: “New, modern, and clean!”
Reviews.Author: ariesgal
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most popular hotels we, local Hong Kong born U.S. immigrants, stay at. Very modern (Japanese cyber feel) very clean. For those of you who do not know how Asians can live in very small places, check this out! They have the cutest room and furniture designs. Great architecture. I wish all the hotels are this good! Great Japanese restaurant in hotel. However, it's about a 10-min. walk to the closest subway station entrance.

HotelInfo.Name: Empire Hotel Kowloon
HotelInfo.Address: No.62 Kimberly Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
